sentences.en: An autopsy eventually ascribed the baby's death to sudden infant death syndrome.
sentences.cn: 尸检最终认定孩子死于婴儿猝死综合征。

sentences.en: An infant’s skin is very sensitive.
An item of prominence on the conference agenda was infant health care.
sentences.cn: 会议议程上的一项重要议题是婴儿保健.

sentences.en: As the protected infant industries grow, their costs sometimes fail to decline.
sentences.cn: 当受保护的新兴工业增长时, 有时成本无法降低.

sentences.en: Be aware that the infant will cough, sputter, and choke during feedings.
sentences.cn: 注意小儿在吃奶时会咳嗽, 喷溅或呛噎.

sentences.en: His only child by Eva MacMurrough, Isabella de Clare, was an infant.
sentences.cn: 他和伊娃·麦克默罗所生的独生女伊萨贝拉·德·克乐尔尚在襁褓中.

sentences.en: Money should be spent on compensatory programmes for deprived pre-school and infant-school children.
sentences.cn: 钱应该花在为不能享有学前班和幼儿学校教育的儿童设置的补偿教育项目上。

sentences.en: My infant for once lay quiet in his cradle.
sentences.cn: 我的婴儿这一次总算安静地躺在摇篮里.

sentences.en: Proximity seeking is commonly interpreted as an index of infant - to - parent attachment.
sentences.cn: 对父母追寻亲近通常被解释为婴儿对双亲的附着依恋标志.

sentences.en: The danger of accidentally overheating the infant thus is present.
sentences.cn: 婴儿有出现过热的危险.

sentences.en: The family were forced to flee with their infant son.
sentences.cn: 那家人被迫带着他们尚在襁褓中的儿子逃走了。

sentences.en: The infant company was based in Germany.
sentences.cn: 这家新公司总部在德国。

sentences.en: The nurse's fingers elevate the infant's jaw to extend his neck.
sentences.cn: 护士的手指应抬起婴儿的下颏使他的颈部后伸.

sentences.en: The operation on the new born infant was a failure.
The soft modulation of her voice soothed the infant.
sentences.cn: 她柔和的声调使婴儿安静了.

sentences.en: There was an infant squalling in the back of the church.
sentences.cn: 有个婴儿在教堂后部大声啼哭。

words.tran_cn: 幼稚症；[医] 幼稚型，[医] 婴儿型
婴儿的；幼稚的；初期的；未成年的

phrases.tran_cn: 婴儿配方；婴儿配方食品
婴儿死亡率，早期失效；早期故障期

trans.tran_cn: 婴儿的，幼儿的，幼稚的，幼小的，初期的，未成年的
trans.tran_en: intended for babies or very young children

trans.tran_cn: 婴儿，幼儿，未成年人，初学者，生手
trans.tran_en: a baby or very young child
